etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in Martin Fotherby (c1560–1620), bishop of Salisbury. From post-classical Latin artolatria from ancient Greek ἀρτο-, combining form of ἄρτος bread + post-classical Latin -latria

definitions: The adoration of the host or the bread consecrated in the Eucharist.

notes.text: The practice has been regarded as idolatrous by those who do not believe in the real presence of the body of Christ in the Blessed Sacrament.
